meanings.definition: If Allah wills or God willing.
meanings.sent1: We will go to the park tomorrow, inshallah.
meanings.sent2: I hope to finish my homework on time, inshallah.
meanings.sent3: I'll bake a cake for the party, inshallah.
meanings.sent4: The flowers will bloom beautifully in the garden, inshallah.
meanings.sent5: The stars will shine brightly tonight, inshallah.

meanings.definition: Used to express hope or intention that something will happen in the future.
meanings.sent1: I will call you later, inshallah.
meanings.sent2: She plans to visit her grandparents next week, inshallah.
meanings.sent3: He will clean his room before the guests arrive, inshallah.
meanings.sent4: The team will win the match, inshallah.
meanings.sent5: The sun will rise again tomorrow, inshallah.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate acceptance of a situation beyond one's control.
meanings.sent1: I missed the bus, so I'll walk home, inshallah.
meanings.sent2: If it rains, we will have to cancel the picnic, inshallah.
meanings.sent3: The flight got delayed, but we will reach our destination, inshallah.
meanings.sent4: The power went out, but we will manage, inshallah.
meanings.sent5: The store is closed, so we will shop tomorrow, inshallah.
